controlCheck.name: Use CNI plugin that supports NetworkPolicy API
controlCheck.description: Control check whether check cni plugin installed

checkResults.remediation:
If the CNI plugin in use does not support network policies, consideration should be given to
making use of a different plugin, or finding an alternate mechanism for restricting traffic
in the Kubernetes cluster.

controlCheck.name: Ensure kube config file permission
controlCheck.description: Control check whether kube config file permissions

checkResults.remediation:
Run the below command (based on the file location on your system) on the each worker node.
For example,
chmod 644 /etc/kubernetes/proxy.conf

controlCheck.name: Ensure kube config file permission
controlCheck.description: Control check whether kube config file permissions

checkResults.remediation:
Run the below command (based on the file location on your system) on the each worker node.
For example, chown root:root /etc/kubernetes/proxy.conf
